data.title: King William III (1650–1702) by Candlelight 609007
data.text:
Provenance

In 1847 Catalogue of Paintings; in 1861 Inventory; in1913 Inventory; bequeathed to the National Trust with the estate, house and contents of Attingham by Thomas Henry Noel-Hill, 8th Baron Berwick (1877-1947) on 15th May 1953.

Credit line

Attingham Park, The Berwick Collection (National Trust)

Marks and inscriptions

On canvas: G.Schalcken (signed) On stretcher (top): Lord Berwick, No.7 (on printed label) James Bourlet & Sons Ltd.... N.50993, (stencilled ink) 545 GS (pink chalk) 2 On stretcher (middle horizontal): The National Trust, Attingham (biro on label) W.O.y (or 7) 421/7/5737 (ink on label) On stretcher (middle vertical): B419 (F) On stretcher (bottom): ATT/P/071 On stretcher (right): Birmingham On reverse of frame (top): James Bourlet & Sons 1967 (in biro) Box U, Pageant of Canada Ex., Cat. 38, (printed label) City Museum & art Gallery, Birmingham, Jubilee Commemorative Exhibition, 1934 / The Property of (in ink) Lord Berwick, (ink on label) B419 (F), (printed label) (part obscured) 26 William III byy Godfried Schalken - Lent by the National Trust, (chalk) Nat. Trust, (pink chalk) 2 On reverse of frame (bottom): ATT/P/071 On reverse of frame (right): 71

Makers and roles

Godfried Schalcken (Made, near Dordrecht, 1643 - The Hague 1706), artist

Exhibition history

Secrets of the Royal Bedchamber, Hampton Court Palace, Surrey, 2013

References

Walpole 1762-80 Horace Walpole, Anecdotes of Painting in England; with some Account of the Principal Artists; and Incidental Notes on other Arts, 4 vols, 1762-80, vol.II p.232 Vertue 1730 George Vertue, 'Notebooks I-VIII', Walpole Society, I xviii, 1930; II, xx,1932; III, xxii, 1934; IV, xxiv, 1936; xxvi, V,1938; xxix, 1947 index; VI, xxx, 1955 , I Vol.XVIII (1930), p.29: [V.7, B.M.9] & Vol.II Vol.XX (1932), p.139: “[V 79, B.M.53] Whinney and Millar 1957 Margaret Whinney and Olivar Millar, English Art 1625 - 1714, 1957, p.282 Ingamells, 2009: John Ingamells, Later Stuart Portraits 1685-1714, National Portrait Gallery, London, 2009, p. 332 Prized Possessions: Dutch Paintings from National Trust Houses (exh. cat.), Holburne Museum, Bath 25 May - 16 Sep 2018; Mauritshuis, The Hague, 11 Oct 2018 - 6 Jan 2019; Petworth House, West Sussex, 26 Jan - 24 Mar 2019., pp. 17-8
